Situation2: Your I04iend calls you in the middle of the night, crying, because they just received some devastating family news.
Story: It was nearly midnight when my phone buzzed, jolting me from the tense silence in our bedroom. My husband and I had just started a serious conversation about our finances—something we’d been putting off for weeks. He looked at me, waiting for my response to his question about our savings, his eyes searching for honesty and reassurance. But the phone kept vibrating. I glanced at the screen: it was my best friend, calling again. I could imagine her curled up on her couch, tears streaming down her face, needing me to listen, to be there for her like I always promised I would. My husband’s voice softened, “Can we finish this? I need to know we’re on the same page.” My heart twisted. I wanted to be the open, supportive wife he needed, but I also couldn’t ignore my friend’s pain. The weight of both expectations pressed down on me, and I sat frozen, torn between answering the call and staying present in the conversation that mattered so much to my marriage.
